channel.title: ShiverOS
channel.description:
ShiverOS is a fun little project I've been working on for quite a while. It's obviously not a REAL operating system, but it's a little java interpretation of one. It can be run on Linux and Windows, I'm not sure about Macs. Enough talk, a picture is worth a thousand words.
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v201/YDoUCare/shiveros4.png[/img]
Download (open source): [url=http://drop.io/steveos]http://drop.io/steveos[/url]
Updates from the last release include windows closing when the process finishes, as well as a picture viewer, and some more commands (shutdown, restart, etc).

item.title: ShiverOS
item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“peterbjornx, post:29, topic:298755”][quote author=light232 link=topic=395135.msg2941356#msg2941356 date=1251911416]

This is pretty cool, especially because it’s open source. Now I can screw around with it (without having to deob decompile etc)

why would he obfuscate something so simple?

You would by surprised by what people think is so special they need to protect it at all costs.

lol, like kevin(google admin) used an AOT compiler to compile the bytecode into native code(rs 317 client), though he still fell to peterxbj
IMO he is an idiot
[/quote]
im not an idiot.[/quote]
i was referring to kevin?

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverOS
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

[quote=“Shiver, post:22, topic:298755”][quote author=Ben link=topic=395135.msg2943512#msg2943512 date=1252067227]

I don’t see anything wrong with what he originally named it. It is a sort of operating system running on top of the Java Virtual Machine. Leave the guy alone.

Offtopic: is this Nightshiver from old days ?

It doesn’t operate the system though It’s just a Java software with a few menus and internal windows.
Though I guess for a useless piece of software he had done a good job.
[/quote]

completely useless, it’s just cool.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: ShiverOS
item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:19, topic:298755”][quote author=light232 link=topic=395135.msg2941356#msg2941356 date=1251911416]

This is pretty cool, especially because it’s open source. Now I can screw around with it (without having to deob decompile etc)

why would he obfuscate something so simple?

You would by surprised by what people think is so special they need to protect it at all costs.

lol, like kevin(google admin) used an AOT compiler to compile the bytecode into native code(rs 317 client), though he still fell to peterxbj
IMO he is an idiot
[/quote]

It wasn’t AOT… AOT is what Excelsior JET does; there is no bytecode anywhere. What Kevin did was probably use a shit-poor ‘java2exe’ sort of wrapper that simply uses CreateJavaVM().[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 02, 2009, 09:53:48 pm[/size][hr][code]004012FD |> 68 EC6C4000 PUSH Client.00406CEC ; ASCII “java -Xmx256m -Djshrink.exe=1”

[/code]

Weeeeeeeeeeeee. PS Learn what JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS is.[/quote]
oh i thought he used something like excelsior jet

Read full topic
